repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Closes #5619

This avoids "cheating" in the limited API by just redefining stuff from the real API. Instead it looks it up at runtime instead (which is probably still fragile, but a little more honest).

Also rewrites the loading of some of ModuleSetupCode to allow bits of it to be defined in the impl/init sections, so not everything has to be defined inline.

comment_data.body: I think #5323 has a cleaner solution to this problem, so revisit this with that in mind.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -757,9 +757,25 @@ def generate_declarations_for_modules(self, env, modules, globalstate):
             self.generate_cvariable_declarations(module, modulecode, defined_here)
             self.generate_cfunction_declarations(module, modulecode, defined_here)
 
-    @staticmethod
-    def _put_setup_code(code, name):
-        code.put(UtilityCode.load_as_string(name, "ModuleSetupCode.c")[1])
+    def _put_setup_code(self, code, name):

commit.message:
Take CO_* from inspect in limited API

Closes #5619

This avoids "cheating" in the limited API by just redefining
stuff from the real API. Instead it looks it up at runtime instead
(which is probably still fragile, but a little more honest).

Also rewrites the loading of some of ModuleSetupCode to allow
bits of it to be defined in the impl/init sections, so not
everything has to be defined inline.

Handle case when variables are defined

which is mostly when Py_LIMITED_API isn't on
Avoid having to look up "*to_write" after calling into external DECREF code.

commit.message: Merge branch 'co-definitions-from-inspect' of github.com:da-woods/cython into co-definitions-from-inspect

milestone.description:
* Remove code for Python 2 and Python < 3.8.
* Integrate better with Python 3.
* Improve support for the Limited API.
* Start supporting GIL-free Python 3.13.
* Support the Py3.13 `sys.monitoring` API.
* Support and use `am_send` for coroutines.

title: Take CO_* from inspect in limited API
